scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe is there. Bonnie is telling them of her
sex-capades.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Bonnie) So ah, your first sexual experience was with a woman?!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: All right, I was 15, it was my best friend, Ruth, and we got drunk on that hard cider, and then suddenly, I don’t know, we were, we were making out.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Tell it again. (pause, we see Rachel is not amused.) Seriously.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Monica) I mean is that woman capable of talking about anything else but sex?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure. Well y'know, earlier she was talking about geography.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, she was listing the countries she’s done it in.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I think we all learned something.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering, hurridly) Hey, you guys! Look what I found! Look at this! (She hands Chandler a picture) That’s my Mom’s writing! Look.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (reading the back of the picture) Me and Frank and Phoebe, Graduation 1965.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know what that means?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That you’re actually 50?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No-no, that’s not, that’s not me Phoebe, that’s her pal Phoebe. According to her high school yearbook, they were like B.F.F. (Ross and Bonnie look at her quizzically) Best Friends Forever.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That is so cool.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know! So this woman probably could like have all kinds of stories about my parents, and she might even know like where my Dad is. So I looked her up, and she lives out by the beach. So maybe this weekend we could go to the beach?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah! Yeah, we can!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Shoot! I can’t go, I have to work!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s too bad.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Ohh, big, fat bummerrr.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So great! Okay! Tomorrow we’re gonna drive out to Montauk.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Bonnie had sex there!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Outside Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are waiting for Phoebe to arrive with
the cab.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (watching a happy couple walk by, arm in arm) Would you look at them. Am I ever gonna find a boyfriend again? I gonna die an old maid.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You’re not gonna die an old maid, maybe an old spinster cook.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Thanks!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey now besides, if worst comes to worst, I’ll be your boyfriend.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why is that so funny?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You made a joke right? So I laughed.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ha-ha-ha. A little to hard. What am I not ah, boyfriend material?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, no. You’re Chandler. Y'know, Chandler! (hits him on the arm)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, so we’ve established my name, and hit me. But theoretically y'know, I mean say we weren’t friends, say it’s a blind date. I show up at your door, and I’m like (in a fake voice) “Hey, nice to meet, ya. Hey, oh-hey.”

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well I’d probably be scared of a guy using a fake voice.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (walking up carrying a brown paper bag) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, hey! Oh good, you brought food!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, it’s just my luggage.

dialogue.speaker: AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Woo-hoo! All right! Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I am having the best karma this week. First, I find this woman who knew my parents, and then my client with the fuzzy back gives me his beach house.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah? What about ah, that bike messenger you hit?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I wasn’t talking about his karma.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (approaching) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey-hey, check out the hat!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What a minute, I know that hat! I was taken aboard that hat! They did experiments on me! I can’t have children!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Seriously, where did you get the hat?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross gave it to me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think she looks good.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh, thank you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Buy it for ya, or win it for ya?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well excuse me, my fashion-impaired friends, I am here to tell you that hats are back.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And this time, they’ve ganged up to form one giant, super hat.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: At the Beach, it’s raining cats and dogs as the gang arrives. Chandler and
Monica are taking shelter under Rachel’s hat.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Go, go, go!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, now everybody wants to be under this hat!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oy!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What’s with all this sand? (picking a handful of sand off of the floor, which is covered in sand)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, Bob said there might be flood damage.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, either that, or he has a really big cat.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Phoebe Sr. house, she is a real estate agent and is trying to sell a house over
the phone. By the way, it’s still raining outside.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Well, yes, it’s kind’ve an unusual house. It has umm, three beautiful bedrooms and ah, no baths. But y'know, the ocean is right there.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (at the door) Knock, knock, knock.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: (on phone) Ah, oh, hang on a second. (to Phoebe) Come in, come in. (on phone) All right, so think about it, and call me back. (hangs up)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Are you ah, Phoebe Abott?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Ahh, yes.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi Phoebe Abott, I’m your best friends daughter!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: You’re Erwin’s daughter?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I-I mean your-your old best friend, here. (hands her the picture) Lily, from high school. Remember?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Oh gosh, Lily, yes. Of course I remember Lily. I... Then you must be?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (points to herself) Phoebe. (points to her) Phoebe. Phoebe, yeah. She named me after you I guess.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Uh-huh. Wow! Well, look! There’s Frank. (points to the picture.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes!! Yes! Yes! Yes!! That’s my Dad, that’s Frank! Yeah! I’m sorry I’m getting all flingy.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Take it easy--if you want, there’s cookies on the counter, or, or--sangria! (jumps up) I can make sangria!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No-no, sorry. Cookies are good, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (goes and gets some cookies) Well, so, umm, anyway umm, I’ve been, I’ve been looking for my Father, and umm, have you heard from him, or seen him?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Oh no, I-I’m sorry, I guess we lost track of everybody after high school.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (disappointed) Oh, okay. Well, so tell me everything about my parents. Everything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Ohh, well. Y'know we were always together, in fact the had a nickname for the three of us.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, what? What was it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: The three losers. Oh, poor Lily. (Phoebe notices a picture on the fridge, takes it, and puts it in her pocket.) Ohh, y'know I-I heard about what happened, that must have been just terrible for you, losing your mother that way.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (happily) Yeah, no, it was great.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The beach house, it’s still raining. Chandler is building a sand castle,
Rachel is doing Monica’s nails, and they’re all drinking margaritas, obviously
bored.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (getting an idea) Hey, y'know what a really good rainy day game is?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I mean naked game. Strip poker, we should totally play strip poker.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: No, no!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you crazy?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on! When you go away, you-you have to play, it’s like a law!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Allll done!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aww, thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, who’s next?! (She looks around the room, and stops when she comes to Ross.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No-o-o! (Rachel gives him a “Please?” look.) No way!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on, please?! I’m boredddd! You let me do it once before.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah well, if ah, if that’s the rule this weekend... (She gets up) No!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes! (she starts creeping up on him)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Get away!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Just once!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Stay away!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Take it like a man, Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (he gets up and starts to run away from her) No! (in his escape attempt he crushes Chandler’s sand castle) No!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, come on!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Big bullies!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ow! Ow! Oh, no-no-no!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Oh, hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, so, how are we doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Bored and bored!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, you know what naked card game is never boring?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Noo!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) So what’s Phoebe like?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m kind, caring, and sweet. What’s Monica like?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ah no, the other Phoebe, the one you went to go see.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ohh, I think she knows where my Dad is.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh well, where is he?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: She was acting, she was pretending like she hasn’t heard from him on years, but I found this picture on her fridge, and look (shows Monica)! Isn’t this what he would look like now?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (gasps) Totally familiar. (Phoebe shows the rest of them.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, why would she lie to you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don’t know, but we’re having dinner tomorrow night, so I figured, she’s gonna tell me then. Y'know maybe she just wanted to give him time to, buy me presents, I don’t know! So, you’re all bored?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ohh!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, I’m gonna close my eyes and point to someone, and you, whoever I point has to come up with something fun for us to do, and we have to do it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, all right.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Fan out! Fan out!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. (Starts to spin) Ooh, y'know we could just do this. (She stops at Chandler)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, umm, we all have to play strip poker.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (jumping in triumph) OH YES!!!!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Strip Happy Days Game?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, I couldn’t find any cards, so it was either this or Strip Bag Of Old Knitting Stuff.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, (reading the card) Fonzy gives you two thumbs up, collect two cool points. Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica, if you get five cool points, you get to make somebody take off one item of clothing. It hasn’t happened yet, but we’re all very excited.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, come on! (blows on the dice) Daddy needs a new pair of electromagnetic microscopes for the Prehistoric Forensics Department! (They all look at him, and he shuts up and rolls the dice.) (he moves his piece) Okay. (reading a card) Take Pinky Tuscadero up to Inspiration Point, collect three cool points!! Yeah! Which gives me five, and let’s see who is gonna lose their clothes. Ummmm, I think I pick our strip poker sponsor Mr. Joey Tribianni.

dialogue.speaker: THE GIRLS
dialogue.text: Woo-hooooo!!!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, relax. It’s just a shoe.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Wooooo!!!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (reading a card) Okay, your band is playing at Arnold’s, collect three cool points. Which means, I have five, and that means I get Joey’s boxers!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Fine. Gang up on me! I got you all right where I want you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Come on, take ‘em off!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Actually, y'know it’s kinda cold, so how about I keep my boxers on, and give you all a peek at the good stuff?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (getting up) All right, I’m gonna make more margaritas! (She pours the rest of the pitcher into Ross’s glass.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoa, hey! What are doing? Trying to get me drunk?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m just making margaritas.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think I’ll help her out. (She gets up to go over and help Rachel, and reveals she has no pants.) (to Rachel) What is going on here?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You painting his toenails?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, come on!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Chasing him all around the room?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, please?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He’s totally flirting with you too.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (pause) He is, isn’t he? I don’t know, I don’t know, I mean maybe it’s just being here at the beach together or, I don’t know. But it’s like something... (she’s interrupted by the sound of Bonnie entering)

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey! (Rachel is shocked) Hi Bonnie!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Hi! My boss let me off early, so I took the train.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: What are you guys doing?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We’re playing Strip Happy Days Game!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Cool! I’ll catch up! (She takes off her sweater.)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The beach house, the next morning. Chandler and Monica are in the kitchen
eating breakfast.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, you still don’t think I’m boyfriend material?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I saw you checking me out during the game last night.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You didn’t even take off your pants.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, lucky for you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering) Well! Is everybody else having just the best time?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Shhh! Shhhh! Joey’s asleep.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: After he passed out, we put the sand around him to keep him warm.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well I assume the ah, happy couple isn’t up yet. Did you guys hear them last night?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, I don’t know what they were doing, but at one point sea turtles actually came up to the house.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Good morning.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Hey! How did everybody sleep?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Like a log.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND BONNIE
dialogue.text: Us too.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m going for a walk.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Good morning. Nice breasts by the way.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The porch, Bonnie is coming back from swimming, Rachel is reading.]

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Hey, what happened to you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, ah nothin’. I just felt like hangin’ out here and reading.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Oh, the water was sooo great! We jumped off this pier and my suit came off.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohhhh, sorry I missed that.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, Joey and Chandler sure are funny.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh-ha-ha!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: I think I brought back half of the beach in my hair. It was so much easier when I used to shave my head.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know, I gotta tell ya, I just loved your look when you were bald.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Really?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Because I think about shaving it all off again sometime.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really?!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean you definitely should do that.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I should do it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Yeah, thank you Rachel, you are soo cool.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Awww, stop. Come on. Now go shave that head!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: All right.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The beach house, at night. Phoebe is hangs up the phone, and gently pushes one
of the stools over.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What’s the matter, Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: She cancelled! My namesake cancelled on me!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, she clamed she had to go out of town suddenly. She’s avoiding me, she doesn’t want to tell me where my Father is. She knows, and she won’t tell me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Aww Pheebs, that sucks!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, don’t “Aww Pheebs, that sucks!” me yet. (she starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Where ya going?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, she’s out of town so, there’s gotta be something in her house that tells me where my Father is.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, Pheebs, some people call that breaking and entering.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, are any of those people here?!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, no!! No, no!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, look I-I-I do something nice, okay? I’ll-I’ll fill her ice trays.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Hey, everybody!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Wow!! (they all recoil in shock and horror)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wh-haa-haa! Look what ‘cha did! (Rachel has her hand over her mouth to keep from laughing.)

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: You wanna touch it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nooo, but it, but it’s great.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Come on, touch it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. (He gently touches it.) You can feel all the bones in your skull.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Outside the beach house, Ross is coming out to talk to Rachel.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I was having a little chat with ah, Bonnie, and ah, guess what, she-she happened to bring up y'know, who was behind the um, whole head shaving idea, and now, who was it? Oh, that’s right, that’s right, it was you!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That was her idea, I just gave her a nudge.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She said you gave her the razor!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: (joining them) Hey guys.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: So, anyone up for a midnight dip in the ocean?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ahh, no, I’m good.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Okay, I’ll see you in a bit.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, have fun! Wooo!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on see, she doesn’t look that bad.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You can see the moonlight bouncing off her head! What the hell were you thinking?!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You don’t know?! Rach, you balded my girlfriend!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right! Ross, do you think it’s easy for me to see you with somebody else?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'know, hey! You’re the one who ended it, remember?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, because I was mad at you, not because I stopped loving you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You still love me?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noo.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You still love me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, y-yeah, so, you-you love me!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Noo, nnnnn. What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you wanna, get back together?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noo! Maybe! I, I don’t know. Ross, I still can’t forgive you for what you did, I can’t, I just, but sometimes when I’m with you I just, I feel so...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I just, I feel, I-I just...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I feel...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Noo!! I don’t care! I’m not, I’m not gonna playing one-on-one strip poker with you for practice!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But I made cards!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well! Good night. (to Ross) I’m going upstairs.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND CHANDLER
dialogue.text: G’night.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Wanna play strip poker for practice?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Phoebe Sr.’s house, Phoebe is breaking in through a window.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ow! My ass. Okay. Okay. (She manages to climb completely inside and the window slams shut.) Oh, shhh!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No! No!! It’s me! It’s me! I-I didn’t want to make any noise!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Then don't break in!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: What are you doing here?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I-I, came to fill your ice cube trays.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, okay, okay, look. I took this picture from your fridge. Okay, because I know that this is my Father. Yeah, this is Frank Buffay and you are standing right there next to him. Now, look I deserve to know where I came from. All right? So if you can help me find my Father then you should! Otherwise, you’re just mean! (pause) So, just tell me the truth!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: All right, the man in the picture is Chuck Magioni.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: My Father is Chuck Magioni?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: No, no, that’s just Chuck Magioni, I-I sold him a house last year! And I’m very sorry, but I don’t know where your Father is, and that’s the truth.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: But umm, you’re right. I think that a person should know where they come from. Wh-which is why I ah, (pause) ahh, (pause) okay. I’m your mother.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Heh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE SR
dialogue.text: Y'know I wanted to tell you yesterday, but I just, I kinda felt all floopy, and...

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Outside the beach house, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler what happened with
Rachel.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I’m telling ya, you guys are totally getting back together!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s not true! Her, she doesn’t even know what she wants! Rachel’s still mad about the whole thing.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, then you gotta back away, all right? You don’t need that kind’ve hurt. Take it from a guy who’s never had a long term relationship......

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know, but ahhhhhh!! I really wanna go up there and finish that kiss!

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: (coming back from her swim) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ahhhh! (Steps away from her.)

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: You guys, the water’s great. You should really go in.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, ahh, no thanks, I just had an M&M.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: Okay, well g’night.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Good night.

dialogue.speaker: BONNIE
dialogue.text: (kisses Ross) Don’t be too long.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okey-dokey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: There is not one hair on that head.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, it’ll grow back, right? And she-she’s really fun, and she’s cool, and-and I’m finally moving on. Y'know? I mean getting over Rachel was so (makes an incoherent nasal sound), y'know? Y'know, and I’m finally feeling sane again. And now if I go up there, and-and I kiss her, and, Gooood I wanna kiss her, and-and-and it doesn’t work out, right? Do I really wanna put myself through that again?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So let me get this straight. If you go with Bonnie tonight, you’re doing the smart, healthy thing and moving on.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Right, and you go with Rachel, Bonnie’s free tonight?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The hallway between the bedrooms. Ross is coming upstairs and stops between two
doors. He looks at the one on the right, then he looks at the one on his left, thinks
about it, and goes in the one on his right.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering the bedroom) Hi. (closes the door)

scenes.location:
The hallway between the bedrooms. Ross is coming upstairs and stops between two
doors. He looks at the one on the right

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The beach house, Chandler is simulating he’s coming to pick up Monica for
a date. Chandler knocks on the door, and Monica answers it.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (in a fake voice) Hi there.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s that weird voice again.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay! Okay! Let me try it again, you’re gonna wanna date this next guy, I swear!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi! I’m Dorf! You’re date for the evening. (Monica walks away in disgust) Oh come on! Dorf on dating, that’s good stuff!!
